episode_title: 116 - The One With Two Parts, part 1
note: [Scene: Rift’s Restaurant, as seen in Mad About You, Joey and Chandler are there.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is unbelievable. It’s been like a half an hour. If this was a cartoon, you’d be looking like a ham right about now.
(Ursula Buffay, Phoebe’s identical twin sister, is waiting on tables in her inimitable manner.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s the waitress. Excuse me, Miss. Hello, Miss?
(Ursula spins around looking puzzled, quite unable to tell where the sound is coming from.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s Phoebe! Hi!
(Ursula notices Joey waving his hand, and comes over.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Hi. Okay, will that be all?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait, wait! Wh-what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, um, I was over there, then you said, “Excuse me, hello Miss,” so now I’m here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no… how come you are working here?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right, yeah, ’cause its close to where I live, and the aprons are really cute.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can we start over?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah. Okay great. I’m gonna be over here. (She wanders away.)

content.speaker: Chandler & Joey
content.text: No, no, no!

content.description: [Scene: A wintry February day in New York City, snowplows are clearing the streets. Inside Central Perk, all three girls are paying court to Ross.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know whether he’s testing me, or just acting out, but my monkey is out of control. But, he keeps erasing the messages on my machine, “supposedly” by accident.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, yeah, I’ve done that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And then, like three days in a row he got to the newspaper before I did, and peed all over the crossword.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ve never done that.
(Outside in the street, Joey and Chandler arrive, to peer through the window at Phoebe, by bending down to look underneath the shop’s sign—a large steaming cup of coffee.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, now look at her and tell me she doesn’t look exactly like her sister.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sayin’ I see a difference.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They’re twins!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t care. Phoebe’s Phoebe. Ursula’s… hot!
(Joey and Chandler come indoors.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know that thing, when you and I talk to each other about things?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let’s not do that any more.
(They hang up their coats and scarves, then approach their friends on the main sofa.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey guys! Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs, guess who we saw today.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, ooh, fun! Okay… um, Liam Neeson.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Morly Safer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The woman who cuts my hair!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, look, this could be a really long game.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your sister Ursula.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, really.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, yeah, she works over at that place, uh…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rift’s. Yeah, I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you do? Because she said you guys haven’t talked in like years.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmmm? Yeah. So, um, is she fat?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not from where I was standin’.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: where were you standing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, Pheebs, so, you guys just don’t get along?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s mostly just dumb sister stuff, you know, I mean, like, everyone always thought of her as the pretty one, you know… Oh, oh, she was the first one to start walking, even though I did it… later that same day. But, to my parents, by then it was like “yeah, right, well what else is new?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, Pheebs, I’m sorry, I’ve got to go. I’ve got Lamaze class.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, and I’ve got Earth Science, but I’ll catch you in Gym.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, is this just gonna be you and Carol?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, Susan’s gonna be there too. We’ve got dads, we’ve got lesbians, the whole parenting team.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, isn’t, isn’t that gonna be weird?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no. (Distractedly putting on a jacket to go out) I mean, it mighta been at first, but by now I, I think I’m pretty comfortable with the whole situation.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, that’s my jacket.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.
(Rachel grins as Ross removes the girlie jacket, grabs his own, and rushes out.)

content.description: The Lamaze class, several couples and one trio sit on the floor, introducing themselves to the teacher, who’s got as far as a woman sitting next to Ross, Carol, and Susan.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, we’re the Rostins. Err, I’m J.C., and he’s Michael, and we’re having a boy, and a girl.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Good for you. Alrighty, next?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, um, I’m err, (has to clear his throat) I’m Ross Geller, and err ah… (pats Carol’s bulge) ..that’s, that’s my boy in there, and uh, (points) this is Carol Willick, and this… is Susan Bunch. Susan is um Carol’s, just, com… (embarrassment finally overwhelms the poor fellow, who becomes incoherent until) ..who’s next?

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: I’m sorry, I didn’t get… Susan is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Susan is Carol’s, Carol’s, Carol’s, friend…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Life partner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Like buddies.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Like lovers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know how close women can get.
(The teacher smiles, but her eyebrows go up. Susan and Carol pat each other affectionately.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Susan and I live together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Although I was married to her.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Carol, not me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Err, right.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: It’s a little complicated.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A little.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: But we’re fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Absolutely. (Turns back to the woman next to him.) So, twins… hah! That’s like two births. (He struggles again.) Ouch.
(Helen’s buzzer is heard on the intercom, so Chandler presses his button, too.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And (he imitates the buzzer) to you too, Helen.

content.speaker: Helen
content.text: Nina Bookbinder is here to see you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay. Send her in.
(He hurriedly checks his hair in his computer screen, before taking a sporting trophy from a drawer to place ostentatiously on his desk. An attractive young woman opens the door.)

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, Nina. Come on in.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: You wanted to see me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Yes. Yes. I’ve just been going over your data here, and little thing, you’ve been post-dating your Friday numbers.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Which is bad, because?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it throws my WENUS out of whack.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Your… excuse me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: WENUS. (Coughs) Weekly Estimated Net…

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Oh, Net Usage Statistics, right. Gotcha, gotcha. Won’t happen again. I wouldn’t want to do anything to hurt your… “wenus.”
(Nina beams flirtatiously at Chandler, who catches her drift, but for once he’s lost for something to say – so she nods her head to tell him that he’s thinking correctly…)

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross, Chandler, and the girls are dividing some Chinese takeout, while the sitcom Family Matters is playing on the TV.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not just that she’s cute, okay. It’s just that… she’s really really cute.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It doesn’t matter. You don’t dip your pen in the company ink.
(Marcel scampers about, interfering with the neatness.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, your little creature’s got the remote again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel, Marcel, give Rossie the remote. Marcel. Marcel, you give Rossie the remote right now… Marce… you give Rossie the remote…
(Marcel points the remote at Monica’s television, pressing a particular combination of keys. The logo SAP appears on the screen, and suddenly the dialogue is dubbed into Spanish.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Relax, I’ll fix it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Cool… “Urkel” in Spanish is “Urkel.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How did he do this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So tell me something, is leaving the Christmas lights up part of your plan to keep us merry all year long?
(Rachel slowly spins around, finally noticing that the lights have outstayed their welcome.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah no, you see, someone was supposed to take them down around New Year’s… but obviously someone forgot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, someone was supposed to write “Rach, take down the lights” and put it on the re… frigerate… (finally noticing Monica’s note stuck to the refrigerator) How long has that been there?
(Joey enters, looking extremely pleased with himself.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, where you been?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I went back to Riff’s. I think Ursula likes me. All I ordered was coffee, she brought me a tuna melt and four plates of curly fries .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Score.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She is so hot!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, listen. Okay, before you do anything Joey-like, you might wanna run it by err… (he indicates Phoebe, who is helping Ross understand the remote control.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You think it would be okay if I asked out your sister?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why? Why would you wanna… do that? Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So that if we went out on a date, she’d be there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I mean, I’m not my sister’s, you know, whatever, and um… I mean, it’s true, we were one egg, once, but err, you know, we’ve grown apart, so, um… I don’t know, why not? Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool, thanks.
(He happily gestures at Chandler that there was nothing to worry about, then exits. Rachel and Monica are concerned for poor Phoebe, who slides back down next to Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I’m fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You wanna watch Laverne y Shirley?
(The sitcom begins with its familiar refrain, yet with a Latin lilt. Rachel and Monica do a little dance with their chopsticks, and Phoebe has to grin as Ross joins in the rhythm.)

content.description: [Scene: Lamaze class. Susan is there. Each couple has a doll, for they have just finished learning how to change a diaper. As Ross rushes in, stepping on the Rostins’ pretend baby, squashing its head flat. It bleats, in protest. He performs emergency surgery, then hands the doll back to J.C.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. Sorry I’m late. Where’s, where’s Carol?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Stuck at school. Some parent-teacher thing. You can go. I’ll get the information.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No… No… No. I think I should stay, I think we should both know what’s going on.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, good. This’ll be fun.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Alrighty. We’re gonna start with some basic third stage breathing exercises, so Mummies, why don’t you get on your back? And… coaches, you should be supporting Mummy’s head.
(Ross and Susan each gesture for the other to lie down.)

content.speaker: Ross and Susan
content.text: What? What? What?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I am supposed to be the mommy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna play my sperm card one more time.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Look, I don’t see why I should have to miss out on the coaching training just because I’m a woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I see. So what do you propose to do?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I will flip you for it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Flip me for it? No, no, no… heads, heads, heads!

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: On your back… Mom.
(Ross gets down like all the other mothers, cradled in Susan’s lap like all the other fathers.)

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Alright, Mommies, take a nice deep cleansing breath.
(Forgetting herself, Susan does the “Mommy” action with Ross.)

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Good. Now imagine your vagina is opening like a flower.
(Ross comes out of character to glare into the distance.)

content.description: Chandler’s Office. Chandler is playing with a toy as his boss Mr. Douglas knocks and opens the door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mr. D, how’s it going, sir?

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Ohh, it’s been better. The Annual Net Usage Statistics are in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: It’s pretty ugly. We haven’t seen an ANUS this bad since the seventies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what does this mean?

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Well, we’re gonna be layin’ off people in every department.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, listen, I know I came in late last week, but I slept funny, and my hair was very very &ndash;

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Not you. Relax. Ever have to fire anyone?

content.description: Chandler’s Office, later that day, Nina is in his office.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nina? Nina. (He goes around his desk to where she is sitting.) Nina. (In pain) Nina.
(She sympathetically reaches out to fondle the inner thigh of his left leg.)

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes I am. Err, listen, the reason that I called you in here today was, err… please don’t hate me.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you like to have dinner sometime?
(Nina gasps in surprise and relief.)

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is at the counter, serving coffee to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Pheebs, what do you want for your birthday?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, what I really want is for my mom to be alive and enjoy it with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay… Let me put it this way. Anything from Crabtree and Evelyn ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! Bath salts would be nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, okay… good.
(Jamie Buchman and Fran Devanow enter the coffee house. They look about them as Jamie removes her coat and scarf.)

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: What is this place?

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: Look, you’re cold, I have to pee, and… (indicating the sign) ..there’s a cup of coffee on the window. How bad could it be?
(Jamie notices Phoebe sitting at the counter.)

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: I think we have an answer.

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: What’s she doing here?

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: This could be God’s way of telling us to eat at home.

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: Think she got fired at Riff’s?

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: No, no, no. We were there last night. She kept… (shuddering at the memory) ..bringing swordfish. (Indicating the ladies’ bathroom ) are you gonna go to the, um?

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: I’m gonna wait till after we order. It’s her, right.

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: It looks like her.
(Phoebe walks by, ignoring the two strangers.)

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: Um, excuse me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: Hi, it’s us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right, and it’s me.

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: So, so you’re here too?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Much as you are.

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: Your turn.

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: Err… we know what we want.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that’s good.

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: All we want is two Caffe Lattes .

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: And some biscotti cookies .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good choice.
(Phoebe turns away so that the two weird women won’t see the face she pulls, and sits down.)

content.speaker: Jamie
content.text: Definitely her.

content.speaker: Fran
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is watching a Spanish version of The Waltons. At a nearby table sit Monica knitting, Rachel winding a ball of wool, and Chandler supplying them both from a skein which is spread between his hands.

content.text: (Phoebe uses the remote to stop the Spanish by turning off the television.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you. You still haven’t told that girl she doesn’t have a job yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you still haven’t taken down the Christmas lights.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Congratulations, I think you’ve found the world’s thinnest argument.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m just trying to find the right moment, you know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, that shouldn’t be so hard, now that you’re dating. (Imitating men at their worst) “Sweetheart, you’re fired, but how ’bout a quickie before I go to work?”
(Joey lets himself in, carrying a large paper shopping bag.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel and Chandler
content.text: Hey.
(There is a loud knocking at the door through which Joey has just entered.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, once you’re inside, you don’t have to knock any more.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll get it.
(She rises, dragging Chandler along by the wool. Rachel has to leap over a chair to follow them. Monica opens the door to find Mr. Heckles standing there.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Hi, Mr.Heckles.

content.speaker: Mr.Heckles
content.text: You’re doing it again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re not doing anything. We’re just sitting around talking, quietly.

content.speaker: Mr.Heckles
content.text: I can hear you through the ceiling. My cats can’t sleep.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t even have cats.

content.speaker: Mr.Heckles
content.text: I could have cats.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Goodbye Mr.Heckles.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’ll try to keep it down.
(The wool-bound trio returns to the table. Rachel has to rush ahead to avoid becoming tangled. Joey brings the shopping bag over to Phoebe, and takes out a nice cardigan.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe, could you do me a favour? Could you try this on? I just wanna make sure it fits.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, my first birthday present… (delightedly examining the cardigan in her lap) ..oh, this is really…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, no no no. It’s for Ursula. I just figured, you know, size-wise.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh… Sure, yeah… (disgustedly dropping the cardigan back into the bag) ..okay, it fits.
(The others have been taking all this in.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you seein’ her again tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep. Ice Capades.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, this is serious. I’ve never known you to pay money for any kind of capade.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. I like her, you know. She’s different. There’s uh, somethin’ about her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That you like, (snappily confronting Joey over the heads of the knitting circle) we get it. You like her. Great!
(The circle freezes in apprehension.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Phoebe, I asked you, and you said it was okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, well, maybe now it’s not okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay… Well maybe now I’m not okay with it not being okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(An embarrassed silence… finally broken by)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Knit, good woman, knit, knit!
(Monica frantically bursts into action as Rachel resumes winding, tangling Chandler’s wool.)

content.description: Chandler’s Office, Chandler & Nina are locked in a passionate embrace. Someone knocks, so they hurriedly separate to stare out of the window. Chandler’s boss opens the door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And that’s the Chrysler Building right there.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Nina.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Mr.Douglas… (flirting defensively) ..cool tie.
(She escapes, fortunately so distracting Mr. Douglas, that he misses Chandler’s expression of alarm & guilt.)

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: She’s still here.
content.parenthetical: Shutting the door, then pointing vaguely at Nina’s shapely departure

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes she is. Didn’t I memo you on this? See, after I let her go, err, I got a call from her psychiatrist, Dr. Flanen-nen, Dr. Flanen, Dr. Flan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And err, he informed me that uh, she took the news rather badly, in fact, he uh, mentioned the word frenzy.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: You’re kidding? She seems so…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no, no. Nina… (miming fairies twinkling around his head) ..she is whooo wewee-woo whoo whoo! In fact, if you asked her right now, she would have no recollection of being fired at all, none at all.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: That’s unbelievable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And yet, believable. So I decided not to fire her again until I can be assured that she will be no threat to herself, or others.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: I see. I guess you never really know what’s goin’ on inside a person’s head.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I guess that’s why they call it psychology, sir.

(Mr. Douglas screws up his eyes, trying to credit what Bing has just said, but turning to follow Nina down the corridor, he realises Bing must be telling the truth, since he would not have any personal interest in the girl, would he?)

content.description: [Scene: Lamaze class, Ross is again on the floor, cradled in Susan’s lap, but now Carol is cradled in his lap, and she has a pretend baby, on her lap. The teacher is showing her class a video, which is about to end.]

content.speaker: Soothing male voice
content.text: ..a sound Mom and Dad never forget. For this after all, is the miracle of birth.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Lights please? And that’s having a baby. Next week is our final class.
(People start getting up. Ross grabs Carol’s doll to hold it upside down like a football, slapping it with his other hand.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Susan, go deep.
(Susan just glares back, as Ross’s inappropriate joke falls flat. Meanwhile, a bubble is about to burst…)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: This is impossible. It’s just impossible.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What is, honey?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What that woman… did. I am not doin’ that. It’s just gonna have to stay in, that’s all, everything will be the same, it’ll just stay in .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol, honey, shhh, shhh, everything’s gonna be alright.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: OH, WHAT DO YOU KNOW? NO-ONE’S GOING UP TO YOU AND SAYING, “HI, IS THAT YOUR NOSTRIL? MIND IF WE PUSH THIS POT ROAST THROUGH IT? ”

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Carol, Carol, sweetie. Cleansing breath.
(Both women gulp in air. Ross looks at his “football,” then manipulates the head & limbs back into place, until it resembles what it represents.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I know it’s frightening, but, big picture. The birth part is just one day, and when it’s over, we’re all gonna be parents for the rest of our lives.
(Ross is staring blankly into space.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I mean, that’s what this is all about, right? Ross? Ross?

content.description: [Scene 13: Central Perk, the gang is gathered around Monica comforting her brother, who in a slight state of shock is cuddling a cushion for security.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna be a father.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is just occurring to you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I always knew I was havin’ a baby, I just never realised the baby was having me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you’re gonna be great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw, how can you say that? I can’t even get Marcel to stop eating the bath mat. How am I gonna raise a kid?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, Ross, some scientists are now saying that, that monkeys and babies are actually different.
(Joey tires of this, so he gets up to leave.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where’re you going?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: With?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, could I just ask you one question?
(Joey nods his head.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Have you two, you know… like… you know… you know… yet?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, not that it’s any of your business, but, no, we haven’t, okay?
(Joey walks toward the door, then hesitates and turns back.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You meant sex, right?
(Phoebe buttons her lip, while the rest of the gang pretend they’re not there.)

content.description: Chandler’s Office, Chandler is working as Nina knocks, then opens the door.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Do you have a sec?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, sure, Nina. What’s up?

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: I don’t know. For the past couple days, people have been avoiding me and giving me these really strange looks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, well, ah… maybe that’s because they’re ah… jealous, of us.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Maybe. But that doesn’t explain why they keep taking my scissors.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, well, maybe that’s, ah, because you’re getting a big raise.

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: I am?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure, why not?

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: Oh my god! (Rushing over to give him a big hug) You’re amazing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you don’t know. (Presses a button.) Helen, could you make sure we put through the paperwork on Miss Bookbinder’s raise?

content.speaker: Helen
content.text: So you still want me to send her psychological profile to Personnel?

content.speaker: Nina
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Helen drinks. (Insincerely) Will you marry me?
(Nina puts her hands on her hips, then gives Chandler a quizzical look.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Phoebe are sharing a bowl of popcorn, while Monica carefully reads the instruction manual for her television set.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I ended up telling her everything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, how’d she take it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pretty well. Except for the stapler thing. (He holds up a bandaged hand.) Little tip: if you’re ever in a similar situation, never ever leave your hand… (he mimes Nina taking her revenge) ..on the desk.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I think I get how to do this.
(Monica points the remote at her TV, and punches out a key combination from the book, but the dreaded SAP logo remains and Spanish still comes forth.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, so, can we turn this off? Can we just make it… make them go away? Because I can’t, I can’t watch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: okay, Pheebs, they’re gone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you alright?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. It’s just, you know, it’s this whole stupid Ursula thing, it’s…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Pheebs, can I ask? So, he’s going out with her. I mean, is it really so terrible?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, yeah. Look, I mean, I’m not saying she’s like evil or anything. She just, you know, she’s always breaking my stuff . When I was eight, and I wouldn’t let her have my Judy Jetson thermos, so she threw it under the bus. And then, oh, and then there was Randy Brown, who was like… Have you ever had a boyfriend who was like your best friend?

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, but that’s what he was for me. And she you know, kind of stole him away, and then… broke his heart… and then he wouldn’t even talk to me any more. Because he said he didn’t wanna be around… anything that looked like either one of us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… Oh, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I mean, I know Joey is not my boyfriend, or my thermos, or anything, but…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not gonna lose him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hon, you gotta talk to Joey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, come on, he doesn’t know this stuff. If he knew how you felt.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But he’s falling in love with her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh please, they’ve been going out a week. They haven’t even slept together yet, I mean, that’s not serious.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay… Okay.
(Monica and Ross indicate that they mean right now.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, oh.

(Phoebe gets up and walks across the hallway, but the door to Chandler and Joey’s apartment is shut. She knocks, and anxiously waits for Joey to come, but instead her identical twin sister emerges wearing one of Joey’s shirts.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh.
(Phoebe reels back in shock, while Ursula defiantly leans against the doorpost as though she owns the place.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, um, may we help you?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s Balcony, Rachel is taking down the Christmas lights. Monica sees her, so she leans out of the small side window.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, what are you doing? It’s freezing out here. Would you come back inside?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No no no no no. You wanted me to take them down, so… (she climbs onto the railing to reach the top of a pole) ..I’m takin’ ’em down. Okay? Whoa! (Screams.)
(Rachel slips, loses her balance, and falls over the edge..)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-my-god Rachel! (Rushing out to look over the edge) Rachel!
(In the apartment below, Mr.Heckles is trying to relax and read his newspaper, but Rachel is helplessly dangling upside-down with her ankle wrapped up in the Christmas lights.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m okay! I’m okay! (She knocks on Mr. Heckles’s window.) Mr. Heckles, Mr. Heckles could you help me please?

content.speaker: Mr.Heckles
content.text: See, this is just the kind of thing I was talking about.
Snow-ploughs are clearing the streets.
Ross has got antenatal class.
The girls divide some Chinese takeaway.
Ursula brought a toasted tuna sandwich
and four plates of crinkle cut chips.
You wanna watch Laverne and Shirley?
Each couple learns how to change a nappy.
The ladies’ toilet.
We want two creamy espressos and some biscuits biscuits.
